channel.description: Official blog for PrestaShop development straight from the product and core dev team.

item.title: PrestaShop 1.6.1.0: a new level of performances
item.description: A lot of things have been improved on PrestaShop 1.6.1.0:

item.title: PrestaShop Core Weekly - Week 24
item.description: This edition of the Core Weekly report highlights changes in PrestaShop core codebase during the last two weeks, from Monday 8th to Sunday 14th of June, 2015.

item.title: Do you speak PrestaShop? – May 2015 edition
item.description: With the launch of the build.prestashop.com blog, we’ve been planning for a while to highlight the dedicated work of the community on the PrestaShop translation project on Crowdin.

item.title: PrestaShop Core Weekly - Week 23
item.description: Hi again! This edition of the Core Weekly report highlights changes in PrestaShop core codebase during the last week, from Monday 1st to Sunday 7th of June, 2015.

item.title: Test PrestaShop 1.6.1.0 RC4!
item.description: We’ve had a lot of great feedback from the community following the release of the RC3 of PrestaShop 1.6.1.0. The team is hard at work improving this version and fixing things that were discovered since then.

item.title: A more semantic versioning scheme
item.description: The upcoming version 1.6.1.0 represents an opportunity for us to make a lot of good changes for both the project and the community, as you may have noticed recently.

item.title: PrestaShop Core Weekly - Weeks 21 & 22
item.description: This edition of the Core Weekly report highlights changes in PrestaShop core codebase during the last two weeks, from Monday 18th of May to Sunday 31st of May, 2015.

item.title: PrestaShop && the PSR-2 coding style guide
item.description: We are planning to switch to PSR-2, here is the why, the how and the when!

item.title: Architecture Improvements in 1.6.1.0
item.description: With the release of PrestaShop 1.6.1.0 we are going to introduce exciting new tools in the codebase that are designed to help write more modular, testable code that enforces separation of concerns.

item.title: About PrestaShop 1.6.1.0: test the latest RC!
item.description: Some of you might know about it, while it will certainly be news for many others: the team has been hard at work on a new release of PrestaShop Download these past few months. The successor to version 1.6.0.14 will not be 1.6.0.15, but 1.6.1.0.
